name: Toy Machine - "Last Supper Deck"
description: The Toy Machine Last Supper Deck features a custom graphic of all your favorite Toy Machine characters, it's their last supper and they're making it a good one. Grip it, slap some trucks on it and ride it! 8" X 31.5"

name: Nike SB x Supreme NEW RARE SOLD OUT Shoes- BRAND NEW STILL IN BOX - Black - Size 10
description:
For Summer 2013 Supreme and Nike SB collaborated on the Nike Tennis Classic SB. 

It came in 4 colorways, featuring the Supreme logo on the tongue, heel and in-sole and sold out within minutes. 

A tonal snake skin effect has been applied to the heel of the sneakers.

name: GIRL x SANRIO - Keropi
description:
This GIRL collaboration is sure to be a rare and high priced collector's item, but as it is not the 35 anniversary board, we are offering it for prices more fair, but still reflective to that premium all things Hello Kitty have placed upon them in the collectables market.  Likely to be purchased by a non-Skateboarder.  

MIN CONDITION in Shrink-Wrap.

name: Sk8Mafia - Asa Akira Kissing Porn Star Ltd. Ed.
description:
The rare and equally collectable board that many sell as part of a set with the other Asa Akira "I Touch Myself" Skateboard Deck, this deck is just as rare and is also priced well into the $150-$250 range on eBay and through other secondary markets. 

As much as it has had a temporary home as part of my collection, issues such as wives and wives and the respect of wives and the ending the scorn of wives were major factors when we decided to part ways, the deck and my collection, and while it wasn't a bad break up, we are kind of jealous of the guy who gets her next.  

A great addition to any man cave, executive office wall, or the bathroom at the gym, this deck is sure to please whoever mans up and goes for a deck that gives back as much as it takes.  Oh and I hear these things can be skated on as well.

In MINT CONDITION and in factory shrink-wrap.

name: The Skate Mental RARE C3PO Skateboard Deck
description:
As elusive and rare as good scenes from the Phantom Menace or well fans who liked the addition of Jar Jar Binks, this well received and hard to find skateboard deck won recognition as one of the best and most aesthetically pleasing deck graphics of 2011.  

With the Stars Wars fans adding to the groups of collectors who often seek this deck out, the force must be with you to happen upon one that is reasonably priced, and as we don't follow the prohibitive pricing index subscribed to by many on eBay, we just seek to ask for a price representative of what is fair on more realistic pricing estimates.  

As we were able to purchase these decks at retail price, we offer one to you all for a price consistent with popular and rare graphics two years sold out.  

In MINT CONDITION and still in factory shrink-wrap.

name: Keith Haring x Alien Workshop Limited Edition (Series I) #2
description:
Image of Keith Haring x Alien Workshop Limited Edition (Series I)

    1
    2

$60.00

The Limited Edition Keith Haring Collaboration Series with Alien Workshop, which followed the successful and highly publicized Warhol Series with AWS, was so successful and sold out so fast that they came out with another 10 Skate Deck Designs and released a second series.

We were lucky enough to get one board from each series, but as that now proved excessive, we would like to share some of them with the our fellow collectors.

In MINT CONDITION and still in factory shrink-wrap, this skateboard deck is a great piece of pop-art history from an artist who loved skateboarding and was one of the first to make a piece of original art on an actual skateboard deck.

An artist who left us all too soon, Keith Haring is remembered now through his art and his fans who keep his unique vision of the world up on walls and on the bottoms of our decks.

name: Keith Haring x Alien Workshop Limited Edition (Series I)
description:
The Limited Edition Keith Haring Collaboration Series with Alien Workshop, which followed the successful and highly publicized Warhol Series with AWS, was so successful and sold out so fast that they came out with another 10 Skate Deck Designs and released a second series.  

We were lucky enough to get one board from each series, but as that now proved excessive, we would like to share some of them with the our fellow collectors.  

In MINT CONDITION and still in factory shrink-wrap, this skateboard deck is a great piece of pop-art history from an artist who loved skateboarding and was one of the first to make a piece of original art on an actual skateboard deck.  

An artist who left us all too soon, Keith Haring is remembered now through his art and his fans who keep his unique vision of the world up on walls and on the bottoms of our decks.

name: Powell Peralta - Tony Hawk White Reissue
description:
One of the most famous decks of all time made an appearance in 2012 as part of a 2500 deck reissue by Powell and they didn't last long.  While many skateboard decks are reissued, this board has become synonymous with skateboards and skateboarding in and of itself.  

Sold out and rare on the secondary market due to their value as collectables, this skateboard deck is a great addition or a great beginning to any collection of skateboards.  

In MINT condition and in factory shrink-wrap.

name: Marc Jacobs Road Rash Skateboard Deck
description:
Marc Jacobs has been a subtle force in the skateboard collectables scene for almost a decade.  

A collector of skate decks himself, he gained serious attention in this arena when he came out with his collaboration with fashion photographer Juergen Teller and produced several very notable boards including the gold standard for all model collectable decks, The Kate Moss board, which ultimately inspired the infamous SKATE MOSS website.  

With an intriguing approach to his newest series, Jacobs wanted to focus on the make-up aspect of the model industry, so the board is a reflection of the mask that make-up can put on those who wear it and those who view it. 

Covered with a liquid-vinyl substance, the board starts off looking like a clean tattooed arm, but as someone skates on it more and more, the insides of the body become visible until the board is used to its limit and the entire interior become the finished graphic of the board.  Although most who purchase this deck won't take those steps to see its inside, it is a truly unique skate deck that is as rare as it is interesting.  

Sold out and very hard to find, we have one deck left for a lucky collector or skater to take their scalpel to.  

In MINT condition and in manufacturer shrink-wrap.

name: The Jay-Z "Big Pimpin" Skateboard Deck by Wemoto
description:
One of the famed rare hip-hop skateboard decks that pop up from time to time, but never last long when first released.  Along with the Baker "Biggie & Tupac" Deck, the De la Soul and A Tribe Called Quest Deck, this board is a great addition to any aspiring collector with an affinity for raps and rhymes. 

This deck is in MINT condition and is still in its original shrink wrap.  

8' Canadian Maple Ply

name: David Choe x Giant Robot: The "Sweater" Deck
description:
This limited edition skateboard deck is by the world renowned artist, David Choe, through a collaboration with the Los Angeles art gallery Giant Robot for the gallery's 15th anniversary. 

Famous for being the "richest artist in the world", David Choe's art is found in the Oval Office and the walls of Facebook's Silicon Valley offices.  

Part of a two deck series, "Angel" is a vibrant piece of original art and is demonstrative of the vast talent Mr. Choe is bringing to the art world and to the world of toys and skateboarding.  

The deck is in MINT condition and is still in the manufacturer's shrink-wrap. 

As the awareness and popularity of Mr. Choe rises, likely to the heights of Hirst and Murakami, this deck, which is already sold out and extremely rare, will have a value far beyond today's estimated value, per The Sk8Room, of $500.

categories.name: Skateboard Decks - Limited Edition - Signed In Deck

name: Supreme x Robert Longo: The "Angel" Skateboard Deck
description:
Skateboard Deck: Angel
Artist: Robert Longo
Skateboard Manufacturer: Supreme NYC
Limited Edition Series of 300
Year: 2010

Robert Longo is an American painter and sculptor made famous in the eighties with his series of “Men in the Cities”. Leader and main guitarist of a punk rock group, he also directed music videos for artists such as New Order and R.E.M., as well as short and feature films. 

The "Angel" skateboard deck is in MINT condition and is still in the shrink wrap from Supreme along with the bag the skateboard came in. 

The Sk8Room has valued this deck at $725.00

categories.name: Skateboard Decks - Limited Edition - Signed In Deck

name: Mekanism Skateboards Artist Series - Delta (Ltd. Ed. of 100)
description:
Mekanism Skateboards 
Delta
Untitled Hand Signed
Born 1968 - The Netherlands

Boris Tellegen a.k.a. DELTA is an industrial designer/engineer and visual artist who works primarily in the field of graffiti painting. A pioneer of the European Graffiti movement of the mid eighties, Delta literally reinvents both the traditional presentation mode of visual art, as well as the genre of graffiti painting itself, by introducing an abstract and highly architectural style of painting to the street.

categories.name: Skateboard Decks - Limited Edition - Signed In Deck

name: AWS x Warhol Foundation:  The Gold Marilyn Deck
description:
This is a Rare 2010 Alien Workshop x Andy Warhol Foundation x Marilyn Monroe LLC Collaboration Skateboard Deck.

Having been dubbed the "Gold Marilyn" skateboard among serious skateboard deck collectors. Part of a limited series run in 2010, these pop-art skate decks were created by Alien Workshop as part of their artist series and sold out immediately via the Alien Workshops website and select skateboard outlets.  

Safely stored the deck remains still sealed in mint/new condition.  Even more impressive in person, these look incredible wall mounted or displayed.  The ultimate gift for any fan and a truly rare piece that will continue to grow in value.

name: Mekanism Warren Du Preez & Nick Thornton Jones (Limited Edition Signed by Artist)
description:
Title:  Warren Du Preez & Nick Thorton Mekanism Limited Edition Series

Limited Series Details:  This deck is number 4 of a series of 100 made and of 20 that were signed.

Estimated Value:  Although there are few instances of this deck appearing on the secondary market, the signed Invader Rubik's Cube from the same gallery series is estimated by TheSk8Room.com to be worth anywhere from $1800-$3000 when signed by the artist.  Although this deck may not have the recognition in the collectors scene as of yet, this series is now officially over and all of the pieces have begun selling for substantial amounts of money

Working with a plethora of creative minds across the globe Mekanism Skateboards has built a name for itself as curators/creators of some of the most interesting decks out there. Delta, John Maeda, Invader, Peter Zimmermann, Warren Du Preez, Nick Thornton Jones and many more have taken the canvas and reinvented the visual. 

The Mekanism Skatedeck Art Series emphasized skate decks as art.  The goal for each chosen artist was to create pieces that truly transcended the skateboard medium and create works that stood alone as serious pirces of artistic creation. The end results were truly remarkable and most all of the decks gained the attention of the international art collectors scene.  

Perhaps most notable of the series was Invader's Rubiks Cube deck, one of the more highly valued and sought after pieces for the serious skateboard deck collector.  The rest were a line of successful and striking pieces all based on unique themes and reflecting the artists signature approach.  

When finished, the series was universally applauded as successfully gaining the attention of art critics and artists alike, and started the trend very much alive today of traditional skateboard companies collaborating with high profile contemporary artists, one that Supreme Skateboards, Alien Workshop, and others have received much attention for by the mainstream media, especially when those skate decks begin attracting buyers on the secondary market commonly paying thousands for certain series.

Designed in 2006 by fashion photographer and mixed media artists Warren Du Preez & Nick Thornton, this limited series is reminsiscent of Ecsher and others from the modern abstract school.  From a very limited run of 20 that were signed by the artists, this deck is sure to be a great addition to the collection of the serious skateboard art collector, and while not in a style typically seen on many skateboard, it is a piece that stands alone as a piece of art.  Based on the small number of decks made and also based on how rare it is for artists from other mediums create original skateboard art, this deck is highly prized as part of our collection and is sure to appreciate in value and in recognition as the number of skateboard art collectors looking for original contemporary pieces has skyrocketed in the wake of the attention Supreme has gained for its decks released over the past few years.  With an extra deck in our collection, and given there are only 20, we felt it only right to share and offer a way for the serious collector to get for themselves a deck we had to search in the small cracks of Europe for, and of which there are few to no of these decks being sold on the open market.  Before these a purchased for good and retired to pemanent collections, we give you the Warren Du Preez and Nick Thornton Jones Mekanism Deck.  Enjoy and avoid staring at the design for too long, it can cause dissyness and mild hallucinations.

categories.name: Skateboard Decks - Limited Edition - Signed By Artist

name: Supreme Gold Bling Skateboard Deck
description:
The 2013 "Bling" Logo Supreme Deck - While some object, every skateboard deck Supreme makes is a bona fide collectors item. 

These decks are simple, clean, and most importantly, they have the little red logo to match.  

Released as part of their 2013 "Bling" Logo Collection, this 7-ply Canadian Maple skate deck is sure to make a place in any growing new school collection.  

Deck is in MINT condition and is still in original shrink-wrap. 

-Sk8Deck Collect

name: SK8MAFIA - Asa Akira Ltd. Ed.
description:
These rare and sold out decks are perfect for any fan of Ms. Akira's numerous performances, those who have a taste for Eastern culture, or perverts looking for the perfect limited edition sold out decks to add to their man cave or office.  

These decks are rare and completely sold out and we happened to purchase them as a collector of rare decks, but the wife does not think they go well with the theme of my collection.  It is really hard to see them go.

name: Frank Kozik - Margaret Thatcher Skate Deck
description:
Frank Kozik
(1962-present)

Frank Kozik is a Spanish-born artist who has worked on the cover art of major rock bands and produced in excess of 300 vinyl art toys. He runs a media outlet and record label and has published several books. Influenced by the growing underground punk rock scene of the mid-eighties, he is credited for solely reviving the art of the concert poster.

In his series of politically charged skateboard decks, Kozik takes aim at a group of world figures taken right of the height of the Western excess of the 1980s, with the companion deck to the Margaret Thatcher deck being Ronald Reagan. 

The Sk8Room has this hand signed limited edition deck (out of a series of 100) valued at $500 (350 EUROS), an estimate that can be verified using the following link:

https://www.thesk8room.com/products/skateboard-frank-kozik-margaret-tatcher#

With Thatcher's passing last week, the deck is certain to become the focus of more intensive efforts to round up the remaining available deck from this very limited hand-signed skateboard deck.  A collectable sure to impress even the most seasoned and well financed of collectors.  

Given our mission to end the prohibitive price increases seen on eBay, we always seek to offer our decks at a price below that of any verifiable estimates and below the average price we have noted from recent comparable eBay sales.  

The skateboard deck is in MINT condition and is still in shrink-wrap with a portion cut out so that Kozik could sign, number and date the signature. 

As we want you to feel comfortable purchasing the board without being able to look at it in person, we guarantee its condition to the extent we accept returns of any deck we send you that does not meet your expectations or does not appear as it did in the picture.  

This is an issue we don't expect to ever occur, but an assurance we believe we owe our clients as we work to build our own brand and reputation in this area of the skateboard retail market. 

If you purchase this deck before 4/15, we will include free of charge a Sk8tologu wall mounting kit.

categories.name: Skateboard Decks - Limited Edition - Signed In Deck

name: GIRL x SANRIO - HELLO KITTY 35th Anniversary Skateboard Deck
description:
This rare collectors item is sold out and hard to come by.  The deck by itself has sold for as much as $400 on eBay over the past few months, but we offer it to you today, in hopes of keeping prices where they should be, at a price well below it average sale price on the collectables market. 

Amongst collectors of Hello Kitty and fans of Girl Skateboards, the Sanrio Hello Kitty x Girl Skateboards Mike Carroll 8" RED LIMITED EDITION skateboard deck is already the thing of legend.  It is a collectable that is only certain to appreciate, and looks great hanging from the wall.  

If the deck is purchased before 4/15, we will throw in a free Sk8tology Deck Wall Mount Kit so you won't have to wait to have this piece of pop-art hanging from your preferred vantage point on any wall that will hold a screw. 

The deck is in MINT condition and is still in shrink-wrap, and it is being stored in a case while we offer it to collectors such as yourself.  We only have one so the first to buy this deck will be the only person that gets one.

name: James Jean - Exit to Eden
description:
James Jean is a Taiwanese-American visual artist, known for both his commercial work for prestigious brands and also the numerous cover illustrations for which he won a dizzying number of awards. In 2008, Jean ‘retired’ from his commercial and illustration projects to solely dedicate himself to fine art gallery work.


In celebration of Giant Robot's 15th Year Anniversary, artist James Jean worked with Giant Robot and produced this limited edition series run of 150 of the 3 deck set.  

First released at Giant Robot's ComicCon stand in 2009, this limited edition run is valued by Sk8Room's Online Store at over $700.00.  

Our collection is limited to one set of three, so the first buyer will be the only buyer.
